root.title: Uybat I (е-30)
root.names: Памятник Уйбат, I памятник Уйбат, Е 30.
root.place: The monument was found in a barrow near the village Charkov on right coast of river Uybat.
root.store: It was transferred to Minusinsk museum in 1886. Minusinsk museum, Inv # 7.
root.general: There were 5 monuments found along the river Uybat. These monuments belong to early nomad times of bronze epoch (II BC).
root.description: E-30 is made of gray sandstone. There is an anthropomorphic image on the bottom part of the stone. There are 5 lines of text on three sides.
root.size: Height - 2,12 m, length - 0,19-0,26 m, width - 0,19 m.
root.investigation: Found out in 1721-22 by T.Stralenberg and Messershmidt. The inscription was investigated by W.Radloff 278, S.E.Malov 279, H.N.Orhun, I.V.Kormushin 280 and others.
root.details: Н.Базылхан "Көне түрік бітіктастары мен ескерткіштері (Орхон, Ениесей, Талас)" //"Қазақстан тарихы түркі тілді деректемелерде" атты сериясы бойынша. II том. - Алматы: Дайк-пресс, 2005. - Б.183.
